intro: Leplaea laurentii, commonly known as the Laurentii's leplaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets and white ray florets. Native to southern Africa, this species thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its foliage is typically gray-green, with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Leplaea laurentii is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a drought-tolerant ornamental plant.
